snippet: Former Chief Nathan Harper of the Pittsburgh police pleaded guilty to federal charges that he conspired to steal police funds deposited into unauthorized credit union accounts.
abstract: Former Pittsburgh Police Chief Nathan Harper pleads guilty to federal charges that he conspired to steal police funds deposited into unauthorized credit union accounts; acknowledges diverting more than $70,000 in fees into the accounts, then spending $32,000, mostly for his own benefit.
lead_paragraph: Former Chief Nathan Harper of the Pittsburgh police pleaded guilty to federal charges that he conspired to steal police funds deposited into unauthorized credit union accounts.
